Label: Sch
Name: C1_School closing
Description: Record closings of schools and universities
Coding: 0 - no measures 1 - recommend closing 2 - require closing (only some levels or categories, eg just high school, or just public schools) 3 - require closing all levels Blank - no data

Label: Wrk
Name: C2_Workplace closing
Coding: 0 - no measures 1 - recommend closing (or recommend work from home) 2 - require closing (or work from home) for some sectors or categories of workers 3 - require closing (or work from home) for all-but-essential workplaces (eg grocery stores, doctors) Blank - no data

Label: CPE
Name: C3_Cancel public events
Coding: 0 - no measures 1 - recommend cancelling 2 - require cancelling Blank - no data

Label: Gathr
Name: C4_Restrictions on gatherings
Coding: 0 - no restrictions 1 - restrictions on very large gatherings (the limit is above 1000 people) 2 - restrictions on gatherings between 101-1000 people 3 - restrictions on gatherings between 11-100 people 4 - restrictions on gatherings of 10 people or less Blank - no data

Label: PubTran
Name: C5_Close public transport
Coding: 0 - no measures 1 - recommend closing (or significantly reduce volume/route/means of transport available) 2 - require closing (or prohibit most citizens from using it) Blank - no data

Label: Home_req
Name: C6_Stay at home requirements
Description: Record orders to "shelter-in-place" and otherwise confine to the home
Coding: 0 - no measures 1 - recommend not leaving house 2 - require not leaving house with exceptions for daily exercise, grocery shopping, and 'essential' trips 3 - require not leaving house with minimal exceptions (eg allowed to leave once a week, or only one person can leave at a time, etc) Blank - no data

Label: Move_req
Name: C7_Restrictions on internal movement
Description: Record restrictions on internal movement between cities/regions
Coding: 0 - no measures 1 - recommend not to travel between regions/cities 2 - internal movement restrictions in place Blank - no data

Label: Int_Trav
Name: C8_International travel controls
Description: Record restrictions on international travel Note: this records policy for foreign travellers, not citizens
Coding: 0 - no restrictions 1 - screening arrivals 2 - quarantine arrivals from some or all regions 3 - ban arrivals from some regions 4 - ban on all regions or total border closure Blank - no data

Label: Inc_sup
Name: E1_Income support (for households)
Description: Record if the government is providing direct cash payments to people who lose their jobs or cannot work. Note: only includes payments to firms if explicitly linked to payroll/salaries
Coding: 0 - no income support 1 - government is replacing less than 50% of lost salary (or if a flat sum, it is less than 50% median salary) 2 - government is replacing 50% or more of lost salary (or if a flat sum, it is greater than 50% median salary) Blank - no data

Label: Contr
Name: E2_Debt/contract relief (for households)
Description: Record if the government is freezing financial obligations for households (eg stopping loan repayments, preventing services like water from stopping, or banning evictions)
Coding: 0 - no debt/contract relief 1 - narrow relief, specific to one kind of contract 2 - broad debt/contract relief

Label: Fisc
Name: E3_Fiscal measures
Description: Announced economic stimulus spending Note: only record amount additional to previously announced spending
Coding: Record monetary value in USD of fiscal stimuli, includes any spending or tax cuts NOT included in E4, H4 or H5 0 - no new spending that day Blank - no data

Label: Int_sup
Name: E4_International support
Description: Announced offers of Covid-19 related aid spending to other countries Note: only record amount additional to previously announced spending
Coding: Record monetary value in USD 0 - no new spending that day Blank - no data

Label: Pub_inf
Name: H1_Public information campaigns
Description: Record presence of public info campaigns
Coding: 0 - no Covid-19 public information campaign 1 - public officials urging caution about Covid-19 2- coordinated public information campaign (eg across traditional and social media) Blank - no data

Label: Test
Name: H2_Testing policy
Description: Record government policy on who has access to testing Note: this records policies about testing for current infection (PCR tests) not testing for immunity (antibody test)
Coding: 0 - no testing policy 1 - only those who both (a) have symptoms AND (b) meet specific criteria (eg key workers, admitted to hospital, came into contact with a known case, returned from overseas) 2 - testing of anyone showing Covid-19 symptoms 3 - open public testing (eg "drive through" testing available to asymptomatic people) Blank - no data

Label: Con_trac
Name: H3_Contact tracing
Description: Record government policy on contact tracing after a positive diagnosis Note: we are looking for policies that would identify all people potentially exposed to Covid-19; voluntary bluetooth apps are unlikely to achieve this
Coding: 0 - no contact tracing 1 - limited contact tracing; not done for all cases 2 - comprehensive contact tracing; done for all identified cases

Label: Inv_hel
Name: H4_Emergency investment in healthcare
Description: Announced short term spending on healthcare system, eg hospitals, masks, etc Note: only record amount additional to previously announced spending
Coding: Record monetary value in USD 0 - no new spending that day Blank - no data

Label: Inv_vacc
Name: H5_Investment in vaccines
Description: Announced public spending on Covid-19 vaccine development Note: only record amount additional to previously announced spending
Coding: Record monetary value in USD 0 - no new spending that day Blank - no data

Label: Wild
Name: M1_Wildcard
Description: Record policy announcements that do not fit anywhere else
Coding: Note unusual or interesting interventions that are worth flagging
